attributes.action: Stop second home owners interfering with the local community plans to develop their villages in Cornwall
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
'FISHERMEN fighting second home owners who blocked their plans to build a jetty in a picture postcard creekside village have found an unlikely ally in the form of an international rock legend.
Roger Taylor, the drummer with Queen, grew up in Truro and owns a home on the banks of the Helford River, where he spends much of his time when not touring.
He was incensed to hear how fishermen at Helford had been stopped from building a modern jetty and access road to land their catch by a Village Society dominated by second home owners.'
This is just one of many incidents where wealthy second home owners have tried to interfer with the lively hoods of locals because of their lack of consideration for the local community. They should have no say in what happens in our communities because they only stay for a few weeks each year. Plans that will benefit the local communities should be decided by the people who live and work there.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
